conclusion: Cart A is moving to the left with speed v1, Cart B is moving to the right with speed v2, and Cart A fires bullets horizontally every Δt0 time interval.
The speed of each bullet relative to the ground remains constant at v0, and each bullet hits the target when the next bullet has already been fired.
The speeds of the two carts are not affected by the firing of the bullets.
The distance traveled by the bullet in the time interval Δt0 is given by s = v0 * Δt0.
Therefore, the distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s = v0 * Δt0.
